Reviews.Title: “Tiny but immaculately clean room”
Reviews.Author: Glow_wormnz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights in May2011. My room was absolutely tiny - had to move my suitcase every time I wanted to open the door. The website is very clear about the size of the rooms and I was very aware it would be a tight squeeze but was happy given the reasonable price. However my room was very clean and well maintained. The hotel is so close to Paddington station you could almost crawl there. The location is amazing - there are heaps of reasonably cheap restaurants in the immediate area. I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: kalia1985
Reviews.Content: it is located very near to the tube, in a central location but they make you pay for sheets 10Pounds and any extra towel costs 2Pounds . The rooms and the bathrooms are like you are in a cabin of a ship

Reviews.Title: “Small Room And Rude Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Alder1977
Reviews.Content: I have just been to London for 2 days as a treat from my partner for Christmas last year we booked this 2 months ago and the pictures on the website is nothing when you get to the hotel.The lady who checked us in was very nice she told us we need to pay for extras if we needed it...We went to our room and it was awful a small double bed,no wardrobe,no tea and coffee,no fridge and the room was soo small you couldn't swing a cat in it...I went down stairs to complain and the manager was there i asked if he had any more bigger rooms and he told me no and that i room was the biggest i told him i suffer from asthma and he told me to open a window...Very rude and no customer service skill at all.I told him we have stayed with the Travelodge and the rooms are much bigger he then spoke down at me and said you are wrong i rooms i the same size and what do you if you would get for the price you pay.I tried to get another room somewhere else but couldn't get one...soo we spent all day out of the room and enjoyed London...Oh Yes the shower is soo small no room to clean and dry and when trying to pass each other we had to walk on the bed...Please read the website if you are going to book WE ARE NOT GOING TO BOOK WITH EASY HOTELS AGAIN```````

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheap and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Nikonaut
Reviews.Content: Our suite at the easyHotel Paddington had a few problems with the jacuzzi - whenever you use the bowling alley in the room, you have to turn of the jacuzzi, due to vibrations. Also, 4 of the screens in the room where smaller than 50" and you could barely see them! This was our second stay at a easyHotel, what you get is a small room in a central location. Our previous stay at a easyHotel was a better experience than this one: There were no extra pillow available when we asked for it, and the staff was less friendly than you would expect from a hotel. It was quite obvious that some people where smoking in their rooms, but nothing was done by the hotel staff about this. The room and the common areas could also use a good clean. The bathroom was larger than the other easyHotel I have stayed in, but older, dirtier and very much less orange than the module bathroom of the other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Get What You Paid For”
Reviews.Author: meganmckean
Reviews.Content: A very budget and basic hotel, there are no added extras - unless you want to purchase them. One towel per person, a bed, shower, toilet and television, even a window in the room costs more. We stayed here for 4 nights, solely for the location's convenience; being a 5 minute walk from Hyde Park, around the corner from Paddington Station and with supermarkets, cafes and other stores all located nearby. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor prior to our stay, we paid the extra amount per night for the 'Room with Window' and were exceptionally glad that we did. The rooms are very small and without that extra light it would only seem smaller. We were on the 3rd floor, and there was still quite a lot of noise coming from the street and through the walls - low voices, people packing in the mornings, buses outside - so definitely ask for a higher room if it is available. That said, there are no elevators in this building, so it will mean carrying your luggage up several flights of stairs. This hotel was fine for our short stay (4 nights, but any longer would have been too long), and is probably not a problem if you're relatively tidy, and prepared for budget & basic.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Cathal M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideal if all your looking for is a bed to put your head down at night. The room is basic all there was, was a bead, tv and bathroom. the bathroom was the size of a walk in warbrobe, the sink was in front of you, shower to the left and toilet to the right. You need to open the window when having a shower as the room got stuffy. the walls are paper thin as i could hear people in other rooms talking and using the toilet/shower.

Reviews.Title: “Budget place to crash in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: aber_james
Reviews.Content: Let us be quite clear, as I am in other reviews of similar establishments. This is absolutely a budget option, and you get what you pay for. I had no extras, and the money I paid could not have been matched in central London. Just two minutes from Paddington station, the hotel is also close to a number of 24 hour bus routes. But bring earplugs. My room was plagued by the banging of the door leading from reception (management: you could solve this with a slow release hinge!) and I could hear people talking in adjacent rooms and property. The room is very small, but clean. The bathroom is tiny, but the shower was excellent - almost too good given the power of the jet vs size of the space involved! This is definitely a place to book if you just need somewhere for after a night out, or a brief stay. I wouldn't select it if I was on reasonable business expenses, or perhaps even if I was not travelling solo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quiet but very small and very very basic”
Reviews.Author: YW L
Reviews.Content: The name of the hotel says it all! The room was tiny - basically you have room to put down your suitcase in the room and that is it. The bathroom was very small, similar to a flight toilet sort of size. Things are compact but got everything you need for a night stay! You will need to bring your own shampoo and toothpaste etc but toilet paper is provided :-) The location is fantastic, it's literally 2 minutes from Paddington station. It is near to many basic stores like corner's shop and restaurants. It is also located off the main road which makes it slightly quieter! The staff are nice and helpful but mind you, they do charge to store your suitcase/luggage, fresh towels, tea etc.!

Reviews.Title: “Very good price and place”
Reviews.Author: jimmymello
Reviews.Content: I have been there last year, and I am going to return this year, I really quite reccomend it, it is very small, but clean and has everything you need. If you want a Hotel and not a Resort, EasyHotel is your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location is the only +”
Reviews.Author: Antonio S
Reviews.Content: Considering that the what-you-pay-is-what-you-get principle applies always, especially when you are paying a cheap price (and therefore receive cheap services), I rate it average only because the description was straightforward and the price still reasonable (for London). The rooms are not just small, they are tiny! So are the bathrooms! One cannot understand it without experiencing it, really. The bed (advertised as a double) is 120 cm wide, meaning it's what elsewhere is called large single bed. And uncomfortable. Nothing in the room apart from a bed, a TV and two hangers. Not even a bedside table, nor a shelf, so we ended up putting our mobile phones and everything on the floor. And I don't think a small shelf would be considered a frill or a major capital expenditure, as they sell them in IKEA for 4 euros! The rooms are so tiny that I really suggest claustrophobics to stay away from here. And I mean, we were out all day, but that half an hour in the morning before leaving or in the night before falling asleep is the most you can stand inside! And I thanked the sense of perspective in booking a room with a window!! Corridors are ridiculously narrow (barely a person could pass through), there is no lift, stairs are small and, in general, you feel miserable inside. A few good points (still not worthy the downsides) are the staff, generally nice and courteous; the soap dispenser in the bathroom (soap is free!! Exciting for being an Easyjet hotel, isn't it??), so are the plug adapter (we were scared to be charged, but it appears they collect those forgotten by visitors and make them available for free to the next ones, which is at least honest) and that it was decently clean. The baggage deposit also is fine. Although they charge you for it (hey, it's a frill to stroll around London without your trolley on the go!), it is much cheaper than leaving it at St Pancras deposit, if you have to take a Eurostar. Sure, round the corner you have dozens of cheap hotels, but my advice is rather to avoid them all and find a bed and breakfast rather...

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location, not enough for 3*”
Reviews.Author: pero305
Reviews.Content: It was surprisingly clean. Small room means exactly what they wrote - itÂ´s small. If youÂ´re taller then 6ft, believe me you do not want this. Great location. Altogether, it could be the right option for someone if they get discounted rate; otherwise I believe one can find 3* hotels in the area incl. breakfast, w/o TV surcharge, luggage disposal surcharge. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel bed ever - Liked it”
Reviews.Author: dancingsandwich
Reviews.Content: The rooms are indeed minimal. The flooring is a kind of gray, rubberized, textured material, which made me feel like I was walking on pebbles when barefoot. The bathroom is tiny, but you of course know that going in. It got extremely damp in my room so I recommend running the AC as much as possible. I do wish there were more hooks on the walls. But the BED was the most comfortable hotel bed I think I've ever slept in. Great mattress and very nice all-cotton, high thread count sheets. I was really surprised. It was better than a Sheraton I'd stayed in, and THEhotel at Mandalay Bay in Vegas. Possibly Hotel Triton in San Francisco had a better bed. It was that good. The staff were very nice and the other guests were diverse, which I liked. One pair looked like creepers but what can you do. I liked how the computer for Internet, a snack machine, and beverages were right there in the lobby. Very practical and no-fuss. This hotel is near a square of hotels, with cafes and fast food places, and a few convenience stores which are (conveniently) open late. There were many younger tourists around, which I thought was kind of fun. Stayed three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Got NO sleep, hated it”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, and it was awful. The occupants in the room above mine were walking around and the floors are so thin that you can literally hear everything, amplified. Every step is roaring creak and anything that moves makes so much noise in your room. The bedroom doors don't fit the frames properly, so a florescent glow comes through the openings and stops you ever getting real darkness. THe toilet was running water, unflushable, the guy from reception took of the cover and we had to use it by jiggling with the mechanics of the flush. Between the noise, the light, and the sound of another room's toilet which must also have been running, I couldn't sleep all night. it's cheap, yes, but what's the point if you don't get any sleep out of your stay? I don't mind basic, but this was awful. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but very small!”
Reviews.Author: Rita2286
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny,tiny, tiny! But for the price you pay I think it was worth it. If your planning on staying at this hotel try to spend minimal time at the hotel because it isn't very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again :)”
Reviews.Author: Ana Paula M
Reviews.Content: Just arrived from a 7 day trip to London. So I spent 6 nights at this hotel which I really liked and would stay there again. The room was really small but as long as you make an effort to keep it organized that is not much of a problem. The window really made a difference in the overall feel of te room. The location is great, less than 5 minutes from tube and buses right on front. And of course that the low cost is the biggest positive aspect. Make sure you keep your room clean, otherwise you have to pay 10Â£ for housekeeping, and you have to ask for extra toilet paper at the reception for free obviously. They provide one towel per person which was enough, but it would'nt hurt to have a smaller one. About the TV, they say you have to pay for the remote but you can just use the buttons on top of it.You can also regulate the heaters, and there are two very handy hangers on the wall. The staff were very helpful and friendly altough they had funny accents which made comunication slightly dificult. There isn't breakfast service, but there is a coffee machine at 1Â£ everything, and a chocolat one too. Across the park there are plenty of places to have breakfast, of which I would recomend Mimos's Cafe. It's cheaper than the rest and as good. Recomend it for sure :)

Reviews.Title: “As easy as it gets”
Reviews.Author: MoustafaShawki
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night between reservations and found that it was very suitable to fit it's purpose. You get what you pay for, a clean room, a clean bathroom, a clean bed. The price we payed was peanuts compared to other hotels, but we only needed it for a night. Check in was very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: AndMor247
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in an Easyhotel and I won't be again. Though the hotel was in a good location that was only thing going for it! I stayed on the ground floor and could hear the bus dropping off and picking up passengers every 5 minutes. The room was pokey and couldn't swing a cat. The room consisted of a bed and that was it, not even any accessories to put your bits and pieces on the side. When the lights were turned off you still had a glow from the emergency lighting!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: katehappykate
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in an excellent location, only a few minutes walk from paddington station, and the next road across is full of places to eat. theres a really nice indian restaurant across the road from the hotel. it was very easy to find. we arrived slightly early and were told our room was not ready so we had to pay Â£5 to leave our bags. however on our day of departure it was only Â£4 to leave the bags all day. there is a small steep staircase to the rooms which wasnt fun to climb with a big bag. room is small only a small space at the end ofthe bed for our bags, we were stying 4 nights so had alot of stuff, i imagine it would be easier if you were only there for one night. the room itself was clean as was the bathroom. definately could have done with a bath mat though as the shower curtain was to short and all the water ran out onto the floor which then ran out the bathroom into the bedroom. so puddles galore! also could do with a shelf or something in the bathroom to put toothbrushes etc. the hotel was quite noisey, very thin walls. also there must be the tube underneath it because although we were on th second floor we could hear it. staff weren't the most people friendly, to busy on facebook on the computer or watching films to acknowledge. i would say though if you, like us, are going to be out all day and just use it as a base then your ok. you get what you pay for. just cheap, clean and not so cheerful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position & good value”
Reviews.Author: kalypso4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position for visiting central London. Yes, the rooms are very small but if its just overnight then you dont need to unpack your suitcase anyway!. It was comfortable and clean and would stay here again but ask for an upstairs room rather than a basement room as it was quite noisy. Very good value!

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here if you can help it”
Reviews.Author: Carole37
Reviews.Content: I was in Room 303 for 2 nights, as a single traveller. The room was tiny, with the double ( ?) bed taking up almost all the space available. There was no wardrobe, only 2 hooks against the wall, not even a shelf to rest a comb and brush on (!) and the bathroom cubicle was tiny, with a minature sink. The room was up 3 flights of steep stairs and NO LIFT-this is not made clear on the website. Oh, and the bedding ( underneath the clean linen ) did not smell too fresh and the matress had seen better days. For this I paid Â£75 per night. No way would 2 average size people have been comfortable in this room. There was no space to open and use an average size suitcase, let alone 2 suitcases! There were noisy neighbours next door and the soundproofing was poor. On the plus side there was excellent service from friendly & professional reception staff & plenty of hot water. But overall I would say avoid this hotel unless you can get a room at a much lower price than I paid. The Paddington area is a bit run down-I would avoid staying in that neighbourhood again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but cheap”
Reviews.Author: Iced_Jelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room with double bed and window (room 105) for 3 nights in November. As has been mentioned, these rooms are very small but for a short trip its completely manageable. Both the room and en suite were both very clean and the bed was very comfy. Personally I'm glad we decided to get a room with a window, as we found the rooms to heat up quite a bit and the fresh air was very much welcomed. The only real problem we experienced was noise from guests in the room above us and across the hall but we always bring earplugs and I would advise you do too as the soundproofing at least around our room wasn't amazing. Although there is some negatives when you factor in cost, location and cleanliness I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Hotel Paddington is great”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here a couple of times now and always found it excellent. Its in a good spot just near paddington station if you are coming from heathrow and not to far a walk if you are taking the easy bus to Stansted from baker street. the rooms are always clean the linen spotless and bed comfortable. All you need for a good night rest. Expecially if you are a solo traveller on the move or just want a london base to drop your stuff and see london. Its also in expensive. There are other dodgy hotels with those musty rooms and run downness. But Easy hotel is new, clean airconditioned. The rooms are obviously not huge, but thats not why you come to London is it? You can be in a room anywhere, if you are in London dump your bags get out and enjoy the city and come back to get a good sleep. If you want a honeymoon sweet go to the hilton and pay 10 times more..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: nimotion
Reviews.Content: For a city trip it's good. What you get is a very small room which heats up a lot. If you just need it for sleeping t's fine! And the best is that you have your own toilet (no toilet brush tough) and shower which is very rare in London for a room of that price. It's true, you don't have much space in the room, in the shower and on the loo but for London price ranging, it's okay! So, If you need only a bed to sleep in, it's just enough! I booked a small room with window.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a lot of room in these rooms”
Reviews.Author: mimimoura
Reviews.Content: I booked a few months in advance and a reviewer mentioned that you could get a window room overlooking a closet with the small rooms, so I upgraded to a regular size room so I wouldn't be in that predicament. I wanted to guarantee I'd get a window to the outside world if I were paying for it. My room was on the third floor which was quite the hike up with the stairs. I originally wanted to get the super cheap rate at the Hoxton Hotel, but the location isn't as good as where this hotel is located and I didn't book early enough. This location is great. It's about a 5 minute walk to the station and there is a bus stop in front. When we arrived, we paid to hold our luggage until our room was available. When we were able to go into our room, I wasn't overly shocked at the size of the room. I am so happy I upgraded. I can't imagine the size of the smaller rooms. There was just enough walking space between the bed and the wall. My husband and I had our luggage everywhere (two back packs). I don't know how anyone would manage with a big suitcase. I had a nice view of the street outside. I could see the double decker buses picking up people. I didn't take any photos of this room since i wasn't impressed with the room. I have to admit it was very clean. The bathroom had a strange smell to it. I guess there isn't proper ventilation. I didn't like how the sink was super close to the toilet. It was difficult for me to brush my teeth in the bathroom. I would have to brush my teeth outside of the bathroom. I mostly did that also because of the strange smell. I am not a big person either. I'm 5'1. The shower was a bit strange to use. There were two knobs. I'm guessing one side was for water temperature and the other was for the amount of water you wanted to come out. I like that there was a soap dispenser installed. You don't need to rent the remote if you aren't lazy. You can turn on the TV and change the channels, if you stand on your bed so you have access to the TV. Internet was expensive so we didn't purchase it. I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights. This room would be ok for a night or two, but 3 nights was a bit too much. It started to get uncomfortable for me and I wish I had booked a room that was just a tad bit bigger with a nice washroom situation.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: PoolieHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for the night and that's just what I got. There are no extras. It's basically a room,beds, shower and loo. That was it. Clean, tidy and secure. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Eastwoodman
Reviews.Content: You get exactly what you expect from this hotel and with its fab location and cheap prices make it a great base for Heathrow and the station. Definitely, recommend it if you are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: k8west
Reviews.Content: The Paddington Easy Hotel is in a great location. it is close to the Underground, good pubs, a pharmacy, bus lines, etc. It is very small, but if you are ok with that then you will like this place. It is clean, affordable and drama free. If you are planning to be out all day and just need a place to sleep it is great. This was our second stay here and we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: Reena P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EasyHotel for one night through work because of the location and price. Basically, the rooms are very simple, no frills, which is what you pay for. It's not far from Paddington station so good if you want to see London and get about. For us it was a short walk from our office so was fine for one nights stay...glad it wasn't more than one night. The room was very small but clean with clean linen and towels (expected for the price), the bathroom was very small (you just about had space to turn around), and the shower wasn't brilliant...kind of flowed between a trickle and enough water for you to wash. The sink was very small and you ended up throwing water onto the floor if you tried to wash your face. The bed was comfortable and was fine for one night. Staff we helpful and courteous even when another guest came to the check in desk while we were checking in asking for another room because of ants crawling around in his ground floor room.... TV remotes cost Â£5 and any extra linen has an extra cost. If you need your room to be cleaned while you are there and are staying for more than a night you will need to pay. There is no lift so if you have heavy luggage I suggest asking for a lower ground floor room because its quite a trek to the 3rd floor without bags. The main road is quite noisy in the mornings so if you're a light sleeper as for a room on the other side. All in all, a good hotel for the price. Don't expect much, it's basic but a lot better and cleaner than some hotels I've stayed in while in London. There is room for improvement but you find that with most places. I'd stay again but only for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Despicable Refund Practices”
Reviews.Author: SF20114
Reviews.Content: I made several bookings with easyHotel for this summer, and ended up having to cancel two of them. When I went online to cancel the bookings, I was told I would have to pay a cancellation fee. NOWHERE on that page did it say that no refunds were given - that my account would merely be credited. I will admit it mentioned in Terms and Conditions that in case of a cancellation, a refund would be given, but easyHotel never said that a refund would not be given under any circumstances. What a horrible policy - be advised!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mica02
Reviews.Content: I was staying in a standard room with window. I was not expecting much from this. I was surprised that for a London hotel of this kind the standard room is pretty ok in size (i have stayed in much smaller rooms in other hotels in London), and it was clean. I didn't need anything else, apart a place to lay my head and have a good shower after a long day travelling around London. The hotel is very well located, only few minutes walk to the underground station and to Paddington train station. there are many cafe's and restaurants in the area, and about 2 mins walk from the hotel there is a really nice pub. It would have been a little useful if they had a lift. It was a little hassle to carry a heavy suitcase up 3 flights of very steep stairs. In addition, I must admit though the bed was comfy, i was waking up daily with a slight rash on my feet and arms.. must be the fabric of the sheets used or the product used to wash them. I will stay there again for sure, as its a cheap and convenient place to stay in London for basic needs.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for Budget in Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: akovattana
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of a whirlwind tour through Southwest England, so the hotel was perfectly located for arrival at Paddington Station and departure on Heathrow Connect, only three blocks away. Also lots of good restaurants nearby. The hotel itself is entertainingly spartan in its orange color scheme. Rooms are big enough to accommodate a double bed with just enough floor space to one side to open bathroom door so it helps if you have very little luggage. We were two small people with one carry-on size suitcase a piece, plus small bags and we had to be pretty organized to function in the space, but it was doable. We were in the basement with the no window option, but air quality was good and remote controlled air-condtioner helps plus the room has excellent lighting. The TV humanized the experience so a remote control was worth paying for. Has an all in one fiberglass bathroom that is amazingly space efficient. Like being on board a submarine. This is the Western double room version of the tiny capsule hotels in Asia. Somewhat noisy if someone is walking in the room overhead, but no one hangs out in this hotel so keeps activity to a minimum. Was surprised the doors didn't make more noise. Desk clerks are pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Might as well all be sleeping in one room...”
Reviews.Author: 25nr
Reviews.Content: Good location near tube. Small but clean ok rooms, quite a lot of traffic noise, just super thin Walls and very squeaky floors, you can here everything from all your neighbours...

Reviews.Title: “For What it is: Ok and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LifeIn
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay in London that would provide us a clean bed, clean shower/bathroom, safe place to keep our luggage and that would not break the bank for two nights. We got into the hotel at 11 p.m., had a full day Sunday for touring London, and then left at 7 a.m. on Monday for the airport. This hotel worked for us as a good base. If we were to be staying in London to enjoy a few days, we would not have stayed here. However, we wanted to see the city, not the room. We were on the second floor, perhaps room 201 or 206, can't remember which number. There is no elevator and carrying luggage up or down can be tricky, but it only lasts for a few minutes. I had requested a room at the end of the hall, unfortunately we got the one at the end of the hall next to that exit door. This room location allowed for some noise from the hall as people went in and out of the hallway next to our door. The floor also squeked a bit outside our door. Walking into the room, there is a bathroom to the right with 1/2-size sink, toilet and shower. A full-length mirror is on the wall to the left when you come into the room. Straight ahead is the window. The window over-looked Norfolk Place, we were lucky to have this with our room being on the front of the building. We had a little bit of street noise as we left the window open to allow some cool, fresh air in. The noise was not that bad and helped to cover-up any noise we heard from within the hotel. A flat-screen tv up on the wall (no remote control, I believe that is extra money), lights within the ceiling and the full-size bed to the right. So you know, there are no tables, no chairs, no luggage stand, no closet and no artwork. It is a room with nothing except your bed and tv. We kept our luggage in the shower when we weren't using it, or on the closed toilet seat. In case of bed-bugs (which I saw no evidence of), we wanted to keep our luggage away from any linens or the bedroom. I am glad the room appeared to be clean. Although the bathroom was small, it provided all that we needed to get ourselves clean. Bare bones, clean, cheap and good place to stay for short stays in which your main priority is to explore the city and not spend time in your room. In the area, cross over Sussex Garden to find the Victoria pub. It had great atmosphere and we would love to go there for more Fuller's beer. A walk to Hyde Park is only about 5 blocks, so a great way to start your day of London.

Reviews.Title: “The room is very small, but its a good place to crash in London”
Reviews.Author: alison_spring
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night after a long haul flight. It really is just a bed to crash in (once you open your bag on the floor next to the bed you can't move) but its clean and close to Paddington train station. Its a cheap place to stay in London. There isn't really much around Paddington itself, except for Hyde Park. Get up early in the morning and go for a jog or stroll around Hyde Park, it is a London highlight, an oasis in a massive city.

Reviews.Title: “A shoehorn will help you squeeze into the room”
Reviews.Author: WorldFuneral
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel so much. I am a fan of the low-cost model and I feel I understand what the easy brand has to offer. But this time I was disappointed. Let's start with the negatives. We booked a small room with a window. I can't really complain about the smallness of it, because it's written there clearly in the room description, but I will point out that the room is the same size as the double bed within it, with a narrow entrance space. There was simply not enough elbow room for two people to manoeuvre (one person, however, probably could have managed fine). There was also nowhere, not even any floorspace, for me to put my bag, so I had to put it on top of the toilet seat overnight. Let this be a warning to those of you travelling with suitcases! Like I said, I can live with that, because we booked a small room. The window, however, is my main source of contention. We paid extra for a room with a window, because a window serves two purposes: to see outside, and to get some fresh air into the room. The window we had in our room was a window by name only; it overlooked an internal service corridor. Our view was of a hoover and fluorescent strip lighting. Opening the window did not let in fresh air, because it opened into another internal room. Having paid EXTRA for a window, I felt somewhat ripped off. One more negative before I get to the positives. While the room was not poorly maintained, it wasn't particularly clean (which is quite an achievement, considering that there's hardly anything in there to clean). One of the first things we noticed was that the previous guest had left something in the easyToilet, which was not a welcoming sight. What's more, the toilet seat was up, leaving it on display for everyone to see. It must have taken a lot of complacency on behalf of easyHousekeeping to ignore that one. There are some positive aspects to this hotel, however. The location is the obvious one. Less than five minutes walk to Paddington, down a quieter side street so that if those mythical windows do actually exist, they shouldn't let in too much traffic noise (you're on your own with the train noise though; even in our underground bunker of a room we could hear the trains, although they stopped at about 1am). Our room actually had very efficient air conditioning which we could control ourselves, which was something of a lifesaver! The staff were very friendly and polite, and checking in and out was quick and indeed easy. So would I stay at this hotel again? Actually yes I would, with a set of conditions. Firstly, that I needed to be at Paddington (I wouldn't use this hotel as a general base for London). Secondly. that I only needed to stay for one night. Finally, I would forgo paying extra for a window, and instead pay slightly more and go for their bigger room option (which is no doubt not big, but may be more suitable for two people). If you can get a room for Â£30 or even Â£40 and don't want any pay-for extras (TV, extra towels, extra pillows, housekeeping) then this hotel might be worth it for a one-night stop. We paid Â£59 for our room, and if we'd wanted to use the TV it would have been another Â£5, so really we probably could have found something better for the price, with TV included. Plus, check in is at 3pm and check out at 10am, so you don't even get to use the TV for the 24 hours that you paid for! If you're used to budget accommodation or hostels, you'll probably be okay here. If not, then this hotel likely won't convert you!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better in Paddington to the same price...”
Reviews.Author: sunem70
Reviews.Content: Great location, but small rooms. We stayed in Lower ground and paid extra for a "window". The Window was just opposite another rooms window - less than one meter. And no daylight at all came in the window. Ceiling was very low and bath room extremely small. The aircon was working fine.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: popstar1701
Reviews.Content: having previously stayed at the easy in kensington i kond of knew what to expect. Got a room on the lower ground which seemed ok at first BUT i think its just above the underground line and tubes pass underneath every 4 minutes. If your staying here get a room upstairs. Apart from that it all went well. Great location on the number 7 bus route and close to both paddington and edgware road. Ideal for exploring. checkin and departure was swift and the reception girl was pleasant. I payed 50 quid for the night which for central london is reasonable, but for an easyhotel i thought it a bit steep. Location won me over

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bucket_au
Reviews.Content: We've all heard the stories about easyHotel. I think you get what you pay for in this case is not necessarily a bad thing. We had a 'small' room with a window. The room is tiny, just a double bed, a hallway and a toilet/shower. There were some hooks that we used for our luggage as there really wasnt anywhere else to put it. There is plenty of easy hotel orange painted on the walls which was a bit much. The room was clean and tidy when we arrived. We got towels body wash/shampoo in one and a small bin. Our room was on lower ground, which actually means under ground. Our window that we paid extra for lead out into some kind of service hallway. No natural light whatsoever. This was the only part that really annoyed us, everything else we were happy enough to put into 'you get what you pay for' but we paid extra for our window and were expecting natural light. Overall we were happy with our little room, but in future we would not bother with a window, or would at least check what we were getting.

Reviews.Title: “What more could we ask for Â£15 each.”
Reviews.Author: Crumpit
Reviews.Content: Yes the room is small, but it was clean and warm. We wanted somewhere to go to sleep, not spend the weekend, if you are a light sleeper then you may need earplugs. There staff were friendly and it did what it said on the tin Easy all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: 01_UK_Traveller_
Reviews.Content: If you want somewhere to stay for a short trip then this is the place to come. It's cheap, clean, friendly and great location to get around. Accepted .... rooms are small and basic but I would rather pay for a room here than to be ripped off in other hotels i have stayed within the Paddington area who claim to be 4*. Staff are friendly and are always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you intend to actually spend time in the city and not the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MFlores77
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great for what I was looking for. I was up at dawn and didn't make it back until way after dark. If all you need is a place to sleep and shower then this place is perfect. The guys at the desk were great and very helpful with anything I needed. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We've been tangoed!”
Reviews.Author: well_travelled_elle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY orange, the doors are orange, the walls are orange. It is very cheap, you don't get breakfast but there is a vending machine for snacks. Don't bother paying an extra Â£5 for a window as there is a wooden fence in front of it so there is no point! It is handy that it is so close to Paddington station but that is its only strong point. The receptionists were rude and didn't care, the room was so small that I could touch all four walls at the same time, the walls were so thin that at 6:30am I could hear about five different pone alarms going off from other rooms. There was also a crack in my door and I could see on to the landing so I imagine that people on the landing could see into our room. The double bed was so small that I was convinced that it was a 3/4 bed. We got to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing and were so exhausted that we fell asleep straight away but even then I was woken up several times in the night by various noises and I am a heavy sleeper who is used to living above a nightclub!!! I definitely have learnt my lesson and will be paying more for a nicer place in London next time!

Reviews.Title: “NO REFUNDS. You are nobody to them.”
Reviews.Author: derek890
Reviews.Content: I understand the hotel industry is competitive and and very cutthroat. But "no frills" should not mean "impersonal" and "frugal". The "no frills" atmosphere that easyHotel uses to distinguish itself from its competition has rapdily become the very reason why I now despise them. I originally booked 7 nights here for December 2010. This booking was just something to hold me over until I found better, cheaper accomodations elsewhere. "Insurance", if you will. I did not consult their refund policy first. BIG MISTAKE. Their refund policy is hard to find on their website and is confusing at first glance, espcially for those that are not accustomed to booking hotels online. It states that if you want a refund, your account (with the HOTEL) will be credited and if you do not use your credit within a year, you lose it. This is not the norm within the industry and I found this unbelievably dissapointing, as I was now out $500! When I eventually found cheaper accomodation, I went back to get my refund only to discover that I had been duped, partly by my own stupiditiy. I figure since I had only made the reservation less than 48 hours ago, it might not be a big deal to get a refund onto my credit card. After calling multiple times, multiple branches, speaking to managers, emailing mangers' mangers, I received no response and realize that my $500 was gone. They do not list any phone numbers on their website for this reason, I presume (but their phone number does appear on the email confirmation if you need to contact them directly). To add insult to injury, they even charge a 10 pound cancellation fee on top of everything. And they try to charge you a bogus early checkin fee if you're there even an hour earlier than the certified 3pm checkin time. So I was stuck staying at this horrible hotel, which isn't even all that great for the price you pay! The location is good but the bathrooms are not cleaned properly; there was a curly brown hair stuck to my sink when I checked in. Staff are well meaning but useless, based on my above issue. The rooms were small and non-functional and you have to pay extra for a tv remote (although you can turn them on and change the channel on the actual tv itself). Rooms do not get cleaned during your stay and housekeeping costs extra. Everything costs extra. What's next? An hourly rate for electricity? Oxygen? All of this just shows me how easyHotel is only concerned about "no frills" and being complete cheapskates. I was basically robbed of $500! You can find MUCH better B&B or budget hotel options just outside of the city centre (east end of the city, or anywhere in the tube's Zone 2). I will NEVER stay at easyHotel ever again! AVOID!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, compact - definately get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Constant_TravellerXX
Reviews.Content: As others have said - you really do get what you pay for. Room is literally no bigger than the bed, the bathrooms take compactness to a whole other level. But on the upside if all your looking for is a clean room and a place to sleep at night then for the price you can't beat easyHotels. Rooms do have bit of an 'industrial' feel to them with no carpets, just some linoleum flooring. Isn't much space if any in some rooms for suitcases, but location wise its not bad and as I only used the place to sleep at night then it did the job for me.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and compact”
Reviews.Author: DrWolf
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at an easyHotel. Like my previous stay (at the easyHotel Victoria), facilities were basic, compact (total room size including ensuite shower was approx 12ft x 6ft) but clean and VERY cheap. For those thinking about booking - be under no illusions, easyHotels really are a no frills experience. As long as all you need is a clean bed and a shower they're great. If you have any higher expectations, I'd advise you stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “You may save a few pounds BUT.......”
Reviews.Author: Sunayana
Reviews.Content: *the rooms were tiny *uncomfortable *we had luggage and we had to drag them up 3 flights of stairs *claustrophobic * the orange wall in the room made us want to puke * we took the room with the window and it felt stuffy! Cant imagine the room without windows! Many of you may ask, why the fuss, didnt you know about this already? YES we did and fell for their trap (lowww tariff)! However we wouldnt have minded spending a little more and staying in a comfortable place in hindsight!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected !! a cheap and clean bed in the center of the city.”
Reviews.Author: snowflakes69
Reviews.Content: We for 2 nights in this hotel, and we got exactly what we want. A clean and cheap bed, in the center of london, in a safe zone, with lots of transports around and in a safe zone. We went only for leisure & shooping, and the bus station in the front of the hotel took us only in 5 minutes to oxford street and Picadily, no tube, no stairs, nothing, and lots of 24/24h buses cross this street every hour. What can we expect more? For sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “You won't find a better deal”
Reviews.Author: jen2pies
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand what the other reviewers thought they were getting! If you fly with EasyJet, you know it'll be basic but cheap and the same applies to this EasyHotel. Brilliant location right by Paddington station, spotlessly clean and seriously cheap (at least Â£100 cheaper than Premier Inns, Travellodges etc). The rooms *are* tiny but you're well-warned about this on the website and I don't go to London to spend all my time in my room. The bathrooms are small but functional - think ferry cabin. You can pay extra for wifi, TV, early check-in, late check-out etc - if you could have rented an iron too, this would have been perfect! I will definitely stay again and will be recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap from A to Z, don't expect more than you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Thomas2000040
Reviews.Content: A tad negative on the title there, but I love this hotel! Great location, right next to Paddington station (for Heathrow express trains) while also well located for central London. It's cheap, so I have not clue whatsoever as to why people complain rooms are small, stairs not wide enough or there's not elevator. They are right, rooms ARE small, tiny in fact. Further, you shouldn't stay here if you're carrying a lot of luggage, as you will need to carry it manually up (possibly) several flights of stairs. However, for the price, this is a good hotel. No more than for two or three nights, but it's cheap, well located, clean and reception staff are courteous and even recognise me (I've been there on close to 20 short-stays by now) Beds are good, but they do fill most of the room. Always enough hot water for the long morning shower, but slightly anoying there's no place for toiletries in bathroom. Wifi and TV usage (rent a remote control!) for en extra fee, but who needs it when all of London is right outside your doorstep??

Reviews.Title: “Too old for this lark!”
Reviews.Author: AppianNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night only, thank goodness. A friend booked it for us and warned us it was basic but basic is too flattering a word. He had a windowless "dungeon" in the basement while we had a double overlooking the busy road outside. There was scaffolding at the window which made the room even darker and more depressing. It also meant that that the window had to be kept closed when the builders were working. We are pensioners, and perhaps because of this, the receptionist kindly helped us to carry our cases up the narrow, steep staircase. The room was the smallest we had ever been in. We could not stand up together, there was not even a shelf for watch/ clock etc and only two hooks. I got the wall side of the bed which meant that going to the loo in night entailed crawling off the end of the bed into the foot of space full of cases and bags. The bathroom was tiny and the water from the shower flooded into the bedroom. When you consider how long architects have to study for their qualifications, it beggars belief that one of them designed this place with no regard for comfort or function, never mind aesthetics! Clearly making money is the name of the game here. I dread to think what would happen if there were a fire in those confined spaces. We could not wait to get out. The thought of spending more than one night there was grim. Perhaps younger travellers could cope better with the lack of comfort and space but needless to say we will not return, nor will we allow aforementioned friend to book us a hotel again. There is cheap and cheerful and cheap and nasty. This place was the latter!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job if you just need a bed for the night!”
Reviews.Author: Roadwarrior_PPB
Reviews.Content: I needed somewhere to stay in central London for a few days, and this place did the job admirably - and the price I got it for (Â£40 a night) is just unheard of in London. It's ultra basic, but clean and professional. The bed was comfy, and the noise from the street wasn't too bad if I kept the windows closed. My only slight grievance was, as a previous reviewer mentioned, there is no space for toiletries in the bathroom - but the quality of the shower (good pressure, nice and warm) made up for that. All in all, if all you need is somewhere to rest your head in London, and you don't want to break the bank, then you can't go far wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY VERY budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonie2011
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel knowing it was budget but didn't quite realise how budget. The room consists of a built in bed base with a matteress on, TV on the wall and 2 hanging hooks. The bathroom didn't even have a shelf so that you could unpack your toiletries. We paid the extra Â£5 for 24hrs of TV in order to get the news and sports update during our stay We arrived at 2pm and after booking in had to leave straight away for an appointment and did not return until 1130pm. Having climbed the strairs, 3 floors up, we got in the room and started to get ready for bed. At this point we found that most of the advertised TV channels were not available, only channels 1-5. The next morning we woke, showered and went to book out. I explained to the reception that i was not happy that having paid the money we could not access all the TV channels, all he could say was that we should have reported it at 11.30 at night, even explaining that we were in our night clothes and there was no phone in the room to call reception and i was not prepared to either get dressed again or walk through a hotel in my night wear didn't work. He still insisted i should have told them at 11.30pm. i asked for a refund and still he said the same and so i then left without a refund very infuriated. I certainly will not be staying at one of these hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “What a damp hotel”
Reviews.Author: hungary57
Reviews.Content: good thing about his hotel is the location every thing else is a crap starting from receptionist to room quality and cleaness.Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “My expectations weren't high. Good job too.”
Reviews.Content: I'm generally not that demanding and can tolerate some pretty average places. But this hotel is chuff. Two normal size adults can't both stand in the room at the same time. The suitcase just about fit up the stairs, but I might as well not have bothered since it then took up half the room. Even if it was cheap, which it wasn't, it wouldn't be worth putting up with. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel could be so much better ... if only they had some furniture in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: coolspot18
Reviews.Content: easyHotel Paddington is centrally located near the Paddington underground and train station. It is about 5 minute walk away. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. When I booked the hotel, I knew this hotel was an extreme budget accommodation - I prepared for the worst. Upon arriving, things were much better than expected. The staff was helpful and friendly. The twin room I got was more than adequately sized and in fact quite large. The room was generally clean, although the room floor did have a couple dust balls + hairs, but the bathroom was spotless. HOWEVER, the layout of room really hinders the practicality and comfort of the accommodations. The room has no furniture besides two beds and a toilet. Over 1/2 the room was "empty space". This means that half the room was "wasted". We had to put our belongings on the floor because there was no nightstand or small table! The toilet was quite small - the room could have accommodated a much larger bathroom easily. There were only three hooks to hang stuff, easyHotel - you could have spent a couple dollars more and put more hooks on the walls! So the bottom line - don't expect much from this place. This could have been a much better hotel if only the room designers paid some attention to the design and functionality of the room. Next time I would only stay at this place for a day or two max - anymore and the lack of amenities gets on your nerves. Oh, you only get one towel to use - extra towels are 1GBP each which is a major bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Small doesn't even begin to describe this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SouthPaw1805
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? As you'd expect from an easyGroup company, the predominant colour scheme throughout the Hotel is orange, from the walls in Reception, through to the bedroom doors, bathroom doors and one wall in each room. Being a budget hotel, I wasn't expecting much, and on that front I wasn't disappointed! I paid Â£69 for what is described as a "Standard" room with a window. The room itself was in the Basement (or Lower Ground as they call it), and the window had a cheap plastic roller blind which, when raised, revealed a vista of a tiny backyard with a ladder and some air conditioning units. The room itself was not much larger than two double beds put together, with "storage" space limited to two coat hooks (a luggage room is available near Reception but, of course, that costs extra), and a floor covered in non-slip lino rather than carpetted. Whilst there was a TV in the room, you need to pay an additional fee (Â£5 a day) if you want to watch it, and you only get BBC1, BBC2, ITV1, Channel 4 and Five for your money. The "bathroom", meanwhile, was barely larger than two shower cubicles side by side and contained a shower, tiny washbasin and toilet and ineffective extractor fan, so it had a musty smell. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms, nor is there a chair or desk, but there are four power sockets, one of which is used by an air conditioning unit mounted on the wall above the bed. Overall, the only thing this hotel has going for it is its location, just a short walk from St Mary's Hospital and Paddington station, and I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lets be honest”
Reviews.Author: essexpaul79
Reviews.Content: this is a cheap hotel, more in line with the travelodge, reception staff excellent excellent location, cheap so what if its small? i didnt book it to stay in the room all day it was small clean and adequate. we booked an accesable room it had a really big bathroom would really stay here again, but ig your used to the ritz then this will be a shock

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Francyuau
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel at the very last minute. A part from the good location (if you travel from/to London Heathrow only), I would suggest nobody to book this hotel and this hotel chain in general. We stayed there 2 nights. No room for suitcases. No room for walking in the room. No room for your toothbrush either. We did a lot of shooping and were forced to place all the bags over the bed. The first day we got up, had a shower and then left the room to visit London. When we came back at night we found out that the room had not been cleaned so we had to pay extra money to get a cleal towel and there was water everywhere. Not comfortable at all. No value for money. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel chain!”
Reviews.Author: twinkletheduchess
Reviews.Content: Start with the positives! 1. Good location, 2 mins from paddington tube station. 2. Reception staff were friendly. 3. Very effective air conditioning. Now the negatives! 1. Very small hallways and no lifts, so very difficult to climb the stairs with a suitcase! 2. Rooms are so, so small. I had a double bed and there was no room for anything else, no bedside table, no where to lay my clothes out. 3. Walls are paper thin so could hear everything from next door, the hallway ( i therefore had no sleep at all). 4. You have to pay for the television. 5. Bathroom wasnt very clean, hairs on floor. 6. Shower wasnt well secured, shower tray not very deep so water leaked out then ran out the bathroom and out into the main hall!!!! 7. No restaurant, only a vending machine. Overall i think this hotel would be great for people backpacking or those with very low standards.

Reviews.Title: “better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: manchesterdoug
Reviews.Content: thought this hotel was really cheap for excellent location, but turned out there were lots of much better value hotels in the area. room was tiny, was like being in a very small touring caravan, only access to bed on one side so was really a single when supposed to be double,no window, noisy air con with bright light made it very difficult to sleep, had to pay Â£15 extra for a sensible check out time, tv was extra if u wanted to watch it, only one pillow very annoying as well. not good value and definately not for anyone who is claustrophobic!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for our needs, just. Pity integrity is also a casualty of a budget stay here.”
Reviews.Author: roaminPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in May 2010.It seems the prices can vary considerably. We paid 30 pounds per night but noticed a price on the door stating 59 pounds. Glad we didn't pay that much. We don't expect alot when travelling budget and the room size was no surprise. Hallways, staircase and rooms very 'squeezy'. Had to sleep with aircon on all night one night because of a horrible 'portaloo' smell. Another night there was prolonged repeated thumping overhead at midnight. Convenient enough but personally found the Paddington vibe dour. Not being the sort to stay out late at night we paid extra for cable tv. They were unable to provide this service and promised to refund our money but could not do so on the spot. We've never seen our refund despite numerous emails. The automated email response is useless and our communications directly with the hotel have been totally ignored. This carelessness in handling problems diminishes any benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't swing a cat!”
Reviews.Author: rovinman
Reviews.Content: It's obviously very budget accommadation. We stayed for one Saturday night in July as we were on a budget and most places were expensive as it is peak season. We had a smal room without a window. These rooms are extremely small. It's probably more suitable for one person staying on their own but when there are two of you, it is difficult to even move past each other in the very confined space. The 'pod' style, toilet/shower/sink is also very small, but functional. I am 6 feet 1'' and there was not enough room for me in the bed which is lodged between two walls. We heard no voices from adjoining rooms however the sound of adjacent doors opening and closing was very loud. The hotel is well placed for Paddington Rail and Underground stations being a 5 minute walk. In summary, I would consider the hotel only as a budget option for a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: plt981
Reviews.Content: EasyHotel gives you precisely what you pay for and nothing more: four walls, covered in peachy-orange paint, a tiny bathroom, and a bed. I happen to like small hotel rooms. But there's a good way to do small and a host of bad ways. EasyHotel was a textbook lesson in the latter. Small, if it's going to work, needs intelligent design, clever use of space, nice surfaces, modular potential. This had none of that. This is design FAIL. Even as someone who likes small rooms, I would not stay here again. Staff, however, was amazing. They were very helpful and friendly and ever encounter. The neighborhood is a bit rough. Travel connections are super-convenient though.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a small room with no window for fourty pounds for the night. The room was as described small but the bed was very comfortable. The room was very clean and the staff very helpfull. I would view the accomodation as the Macdonalds fast food resturant of the hotel world. You go to Macdonalds not to get fine food but a cheap, convienant meal that is prepared in a clean environment. That is what an esayjet hotel is cheap clean and convienant. If you want a fine roomy hotel then pay fine prices. I twin room in a cheap youth hostel would have cost me Â£60 with a shared bathroom. This room was Â£40 with my own bathroom. So people need to put into presective what they are paying for before they nit pick

Reviews.Title: “A step above a hostel but without any of the charm or fun.”
Reviews.Author: canadiankiwi2
Reviews.Content: I "splurge" for the largest possible room with a window and it was still the SMALLEST room I have ever stayed in. There was just enough room for the bed and that's it! I can't imagine what a smaller room without a window would be like. Definitely not worth the price. London is expensive but save a little more & get a proper hotel. The bathroom is tiny. I shared a room with a friend and there was no room to even get dressed, nowhere to place a toothbrush or toothpaste. This hotel is definitely for the short & slim - I couldn't imagine what a 6' tall person would do in here. Good location though. And clean. I was unhappy about the reception. A friend (not staying at the hotel) gave the reception my name & the receptionist told him exactly what room I was in & to walk up into it. Random guy, unknown to reception walked in from the street was told my exact room number just with my name and was waved through. Harmless enough in this situation & I didn't complain but it irritated me. This is good for a solo traveller without much luggage but other than that, I would not recommend this hotel. And not for a long time either - 1 or 2 nights is more than plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly objectionable: If you like prison cells, stay here”
Reviews.Author: martello2
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked this room for the night before we flew from Heathrow after a month of walking tours. I also prebooked 24 other rooms along the way. A few of those other rooms were of course less than perfect but I was happy to stay in all of them without complaint -- I wasn't seeking perfection, just a simple, clean, reasonably attractive place to stay a night. Unfortunately, the minute we walked into our room at EasyHotel Paddington, we were stunned into silence. It was not a habitable room, unless you want to feel depressed and suicidal, which this room made us feel. We stayed in 25 B&Bs and hotels during this trip, all of them booked sight unseen, and this was the ONLY one we found objectionable. It had nothing in it except a bed and a TV -- no chair, no table (and frankly no room for either). It was incredibly grim. We told the front desk clerk we didn't like the room and couldn't possibly stay there, but he didn't offer us another room. We left knowing full well we might not get a refund, but it was worth possibly paying double the cost for a room in London simply so we didn't have to stay in EasyHotel Paddington. This says a LOT because I am an incredible cheapskate so for me to willingly leave a paid-for room behind speaks volumes. I had asked the desk clerk for a refund but because I'd booked online he could not help me. I have since tried to contact EasyHotel for a refund but there appears no way to contact them (at least not that I can find), so I have contacted my bank, which is looking into issuing me a refund.

Reviews.Title: “OK for London”
Reviews.Author: Andrew9
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, London is terrible when it comes to quality budget hotels. Paying over Â£60 a night for an easyHotel room would be unacceptable almost anywhere else but in London it's not too bad. Positives - Fairly good location by Sussex Gardens and ideal for arriving or departing from early Paddington station with a decent, though not great, selection of fast food restaurants and pubs within a 5 minute walk. - Bus stop right outside the door. Getting to and from central London is easy. (See also negatives) - The room was clean upon arrival (They charge Â£10 to clean the room during your stay). - The reception staff I encountered were all friendly. - Warm. You can control the heat in the room by turning the radiator knob. You could have it roasting hot or not on at all. I found this handy for drying some of my clothes. - A good firm bed. Negatives - The smallness of the room, though expected, got frustrating. It was difficult to unpack any luggage as there was nowhere to put anything. - Late check-in. At 3pm it's too late in the afternoon. They also charge Â£5 if you check-in early within an hour of 3pm you are charged Â£5. Between one and two hours early and it's Â£10 and so on. - Other fees include Â£1 for an extra towel, Â£2 for a pillow or extra sheet hire, Â£5 per day to have TV, and their WI-FI tariff is Â£5 per hour or Â£10 per day. - As mentioned above it is right across the street from a bus stop. A total of 7 local buses stop there from early morning right through the entire night. This is good for travel but bad for sleeping. Even after midnight the buses arrive every 5 minutes or so. Bring ear plugs! - Though the bathroom was otherwise fine, even good by budget standards, getting the right water temperature was difficult though not impossible. Despite the negatives next trip to London I'll again consider easyHotel Paddington though for no more than 2 or 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE at EASYHOTEL Paddington”
Reviews.Author: edoardomilan
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised and disappointed regarding my stay at this hotel. We arrived on the 5th of january, our room was G4 on the ground floor and it was bad maintained: one of the lights over the bed was not working, we immediately advised the reception and they took 3 days to change it. Then the aspirator in the toilet stopped working, we advised the reception on saturday (9th) and they did not seem very worried/interested and they didn't do anything about it nor they proposed to change us room - considering that our room did not have a window we spent the last 2 days in a bad condition (very hot inside, humid because of no change of air, etc...we had to leave the door open during the day while we were there!!). The faucet in the shower did not work properly, the water was scalding or very cold. The floor and under the matress was quite dirty with dust grains. Being a mistery shopper for some retail chains I am very keen on details and observation. More over, apart a couple of receptionists, the majority of the personnel was very unwelcoming (no hellos, no smiles): a female receptionist was very "rude" on the first day as we did not have any cash to pay for the baggages we left in the checkroom. I proposed to pay with a credit card and she said: "we do not accept cards for amounts less than 10Â£....so you don't have any money?? you can go to the ATM machine outside". She could have proposed to wait for the payment until next day...a bit of flexibility sometimes it helps working better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, perfect for knowing London city”
Reviews.Author: necpt
Reviews.Content: easyHotel Paddington was like a shining-star hidden in the darkness of London low-budget hotels. Me and my girlfriend were almost losing our nerves about all the reviews we read here about roaches and fleas among beds and so. When you looked at the pictures of easyHotel Paddington and read the reviews we didn't think twice and booked a standard room with window for 3 nights. The hotel and the room are exactly like the photos, small but comfortable, the ideal place to get to know the city. London isn't the type of city you can afford to waste just to get a nap. The staff is very helpful and there are buses and underground nearby (5 minutes slow walk) as well as McDonald's, Burger King and Steak Houses as well as convenience stores so you can eat fast and warm food anytime. We'd like that there were some shelves or something to put things in but as long as you keep things packed and you're not too messy there won't be nothing but clothes all over the place as the room space doesn't allow much than just you need. Me and my girlfriend were so much delighted for the perfect hotel for its price that you are waiting for more easyHotel openings so you can travel and not to worry about what we'll find when you arrive so you can enjoy our destinations. It's an ABSOLUTE YES.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: larainthesky
Reviews.Content: The main advantages of this hotel is its location, price and cleanliness. Close to Paddington station, you can get the tube or trains to other cities and to Heathrow Airport. The price is great for the central location. But if you need any extra service, it will be charged. Cleaning, luggage storing, extra towels, and even remote control for the TV are charged. The room was perfectly clean when we got it.This is a main point and I was very satisfied for that. The worst thing there was the shower. It is so small that you can't have a proper shower. And the water temperature was not constant, it varied from warm to cold then to boiling, it was a torture, really. And it was not a problem of just one room, because we ended up staying in two different rooms and faced this problem on both of them. The staff consists in one atendant (plus the room cleaner), and I came across a very simpathetic and helpful one, but a few bored/boring/cold others. The hotel is one of many hotels in the area. The Norfolk Street totally occupied by small hotels. The neighborhood is full of restaurants, souvenier shops and a few grocery stores. I would stay again only if they fix that shower.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good location but rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: edwardmanics
Reviews.Content: One of the cheaper places to stay in London Close to one of the main train stations in London, Paddington But rooms are too small and toilets even smaller. Too small for a couple to stay. Not enough walking spaces. No wardrobe to put clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cost-benefit”
Reviews.Author: jmurilo
Reviews.Content: You will not be caught by surprise by the size of the room, because I had the opportunity to see the picture. Good quality sleep and bathe because you do not go to London to stay in a hotel room ...

Reviews.Title: “Taking basic maybe a little too far?”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel before an early morning flight from Heathrow, I found that the Easyhotel (booked well in advance) combined with the Heathrow Exspress from Paddington, a few minutes walk away, provided the most efficient and cost-effective option. Yes, they warn you that the rooms are small. I had a standard room with window, and that was small enough. A small room with no window must be claustrophobic. Still, it was fine for what I needed. There was a bed, a toilet, a washbasin and a (very good) shower with soap provided. There were pillows, a duvet and towels. And that was it. The one major thing that is missing is anywhere to put anything. There are no shelves whatsoever. This means nothing at the bedside to put things like glasses, watches or alarm clock on. The bed really could have been moved a few inches down to allow a ledge at the head. Similarly, nowhere to put anything in the very cramped bathroom. And nowhere to hang clothes. You really are living out of your suitcase here - except there's nowhere to put your suitcase except at the toot of the bed. Otherwise, as the website clearly states, any extras are chargeable, although I find the prices excessive. I had my own laptop with internet dongle, so I had no need of their TV or wifi. There is no lift, so if you are put on the third floor (as I was) it's a hike. Generally the hotel is quiet, although heavy doors make for loud banging as people enter and leave rooms, and the floors in the halls creak. The bed was comfortable, and I slept fine. All in all, this hotel was exactly what I needed, basic accommodation without paying for frills I didn't need. However, I do think they take basic too far with the lack of storage space in the room, and two people staying in one of these rooms (especially a small room) for a week with a week's worth of luggage might struggle, It is better for a solo traveller or a couple on a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: ayepod
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, and it did the job we were looking for. Bit cramped, but bed was very comfy, room clean and shower powerful. Don't get too excited about having a window, as ours looked onto a pretty minging courtyard, but you're in London so you shouldn't really be spending too much time in your room! And considering the standard of hotels in London is usually pretty poor, Easyhotel does the job! Overall, good value for money, but wouldn't like to be there for several days!

Reviews.Title: “would prefer to pay more”
Reviews.Author: JKL21
Reviews.Content: Small completely bare bones rooms. A swung cat would soon be brained. Have been pared down too far so even things like a shelf in the bathroom are missing and had to put toiletries on top of the radiator. Zero storage apart from a few hooks on the wall. Very little room to manoeuvre around the room if there are two of you. Can fit luggage at base of bed but then need to climb over each other to use the bathroom in the night. Has aircon but still hot so not a good night's sleep which was important before a long haul. Noisy fire doors can easily be heard. The one socket is inconveniently above the bed head. The lurid orange wall behind the bed is a very bad idea. Very handy for Paddington to Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “Ok deal, but then again, it's London”
Reviews.Author: lilorchid82
Reviews.Content: I wanted the cheapest room avail with a good central location and cleanliness. This fits the bill. First of all, I read the reviews, so I knew the room would be a closet. There was only area around the bed to walk, no closet. The bathroom was tiny too; you could even wash your hand while still sitting on the toilet. Not that I would, that's just how small the bathroom was. They provide you with soap and shampoo from a dispenser. I preferred the toiletry I brought. The service was lackluster. I was told that the room would be 39 GBP per night, but it came out to like 50 something. The problem is that they just give you the total price and don't itemize the costs for you. So I assume that the VAT was not included in the advertised price...even so that's big increase...so there must have been some other fees. The front desk person was not helpful. They said that they could not pull up the info on their computer. I guess that's what keeps the cost down. Despite paying about 100 USD a night, this was still a great deal for this area. We paid extra to have internet...I don't remember...20ish GBP for 5 days or something. The area was great. This was a 3 min walk from the Paddington Tube Station, and had lots of convenience stores and restaurants around. About a 10-15 min walk to Hyde Park. Rooms are not cleaned while you're there...I think you pay extra 10 GBP for that. Bottom line: Don't expect much and you'll be satisfied. Great location, lackluster service.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, but perfect if you just need a bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: hardsell
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a small ground floor double room, no window, with my 5 y.o. son while we were sightseeing in London. Is ideally positioned 5 minutes walk from Paddington Station so is great for either linking with the Heathrow Express or using the Underground to get around town. Plenty of food choices around, nothing fancy but youâ€™ll get a satisfying feed (The Exchange near the local Laundromat is a kid friendly pub with good hospitality, and the food is tasty and cheap) Sainsburys and M&S have express stores at the train station so you can get the basics at reasonable prices Check in process went without a hitch, and they even let us check in early without charging us extra. Reception is manned 24 hours and everyone we dealt with on there was friendly and tried to be helpful, including booking us hire car for our early departure. Now to the room. I knew it was going to be small, website has dimensions etc but was still taken aback at the lack of usable floor space for bags and moving around. Effectively good sized double bed surrounded by the walls on three sides with a little built in bedside table. My carry -on luggage took all the little bit of floor by the bedside table. That leaves the area between the door, bathroom and bed. About 6 feet long by two and bit feet wide my big case used most of that. I expected a small room, had read the reviews and basically itâ€™s exactly what I thought itâ€™d be. If you donâ€™t mind stepping over your luggage you wonâ€™t find it a problem. Bathroom tiny like onboard a ship, but very clean and functional. Must say bed was really comfortable too. Room has small LCD TV (you pay to get the remote which is worthwhile) and we had an air con unit so could control temp really well. Wi-Fi available and vending machines in reception Iâ€™d stay here again â€“ cheap, clean and good location. Not everyoneâ€™s cup of tea, but if all you need is a bed easyHotel is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good location, no frills whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: PicadillyCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel knows its audience. In a city of VERY expensive hotels, the easyHotel is filling a void. The rooms are TINY but the website says as much, and there's no way in a city like London that you're going to spend any time in the hotel room anyway. Our room had its own bathroom - big plus - and a window. "No window" is an option but I wouldn't recommend it; that'd be like sleeping in a stuffy shoebox! One caution though...the shower doesn't have a "lip" on the bottom to catch water. I nearly flooded our entire hotel room! Don't use the shower full blast. The easyHotel Paddington is a five-minute walk from Paddington Station where you can catch regional trains (i.e. to Windor Castle) or the Tube to central London and all the touristy sites. London's tube is just the best public transportation system I've ever seen, so you don't even need to worry about the fact that this hotel isn't right in the middle of the action. It's surrounded by cheap little restaurants and pubs, too, so there's plenty of food options. I would stay here again. It was perfect for a couple of backpackers who wanted to experience London without going broke.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you're after.”
Reviews.Author: GMT_Bristol
Reviews.Content: OK - first thing first, my 'real' score for this place is 2.5! I felt a 2 would be unfair, so I've had to bump it up to a somewhat generous 3.
